data.title: Queen Elisabeth Competition
data.meta_description: Jonathan Fournel studied at the Hochschule für Musik in Saarbrücken under Robert Leonardy, then at the Conservatoire National Supérieur de Musique et de Danse de Paris, where he took classes with Bruno Rigutto, Brigitte Engerer, Claire Désert, and Michel Dalberto. In 2013 he has won the first prize at the Concorso Gian Battista Viotti in Vercelli in Italy and in 2014 at the Scottish International Piano Competition in Glasgow. He has performed, among others, with the Orchestre National de Lorraine, the Radio and Television Orchestra in Zagreb, the Jiangsu Symphony Orchestra, the Orchestre Royal de Chambre de Wallonie, the Dubrovnik Symphony Orchestra, Sinfonia Varsovia, and the Royal Scottish National Orchestra, and with conductors such as Frank Braley, Jonathon Heyward, and Gergely Madaras. From 2016 to 2021, Jonathan Fournel has been an artist in residence at the Queen Elisabeth Music Chapel, under the guidance of Louis Lortie. In 2017 he was selected as a ‘révélation classique’ by the Adami. His first album is dedicated to works by Brahms and appeared in 2021 on the Alpha label.
data.text:
Jonathan Fournel studied at the Hochschule für Musik in Saarbrücken under Robert Leonardy, then at the Conservatoire National Supérieur de Musique et de Danse de Paris, where he took classes with Bruno Rigutto, Brigitte Engerer, Claire Désert, and Michel Dalberto. In 2013 he has won the first prize at the Concorso Gian Battista Viotti in Vercelli in Italy and in 2014 at the Scottish International Piano Competition in Glasgow. He has performed, among others, with the Orchestre National de Lorraine, the Radio and Television Orchestra in Zagreb, the Jiangsu Symphony Orchestra, the Orchestre Royal de Chambre de Wallonie, the Dubrovnik Symphony Orchestra, Sinfonia Varsovia, and the Royal Scottish National Orchestra, and with conductors such as Frank Braley, Jonathon Heyward, and Gergely Madaras. From 2016 to 2021, Jonathan Fournel has been an artist in residence at the Queen Elisabeth Music Chapel, under the guidance of Louis Lortie. In 2017 he was selected as a ‘révélation classique’ by the Adami. His first album is dedicated to works by Brahms and appeared in 2021 on the Alpha label.

Teachers

2016 - : Louis Lortie & Avo Kouyoumdjian

2013 - 2016 : Michel Dalberto & Claire-Marie Leguay

2012 - 2013 : Claire Desert & Emmanuel Mercier

2010 - 2012 : Brigitte Engerer & Emmanuel Mercier

2009 - 2010 : Bruno Rigutto & Fernando Rossano

2005 - 2009 : Robert Leonardy & Jean Micault

2001 - 2005 : Stéphane Seban

2000 - 2001 : Marianne Henry

Degrees

2016 - : Artist Diploma, Queen Elisabeth Music Chapel

2009 - 2016 : Diplome d'Artiste Interprète, Conservatoire National Supérieur de Musique de Paris

2005 - 2009 : Jungstudierende, Hochschule für Musik Saar

2001 - 2005 : Second cycle, Conservatoire de Strasbourg

2000 - 2001 : premier cycle, Conservatoire de Sarreguemines

Concerts

2019 : Osaka Symphony Hall (Osaka, Japan), Kansai Symphony Orchestra, dir. Augustin Dumay

2019 : City Art Gallery (Varna, Bulgaria), Varna Music Festival, Brahms Violin Sonatas with Augustin Dumay

2018 : Parc du Chateau de Florans, La Roque d'Anthéron, Récital

2018 : Flagey (Brussel, Belgium), Flagey Festival, Brussels Philharmonic, dir. Stéphane Dénève

2018 : Auditorium Stéphane Zweig (Nantes, France), La Folle Journée de Nantes, Sinfonia Varsovia, dir. Lio Kuokman

2018 : Auditorium Jean-Pierre Dautel (Caen, France), Orchestre de Caen, dir. Vahan Mardirossian

2017 : Nanjing Zijin Grand Theater (Nanjing, China), Jiangsu Symphony Orchestra, dir. Éric Lederhandler

2017 : Concert Hall (Zilina, Slovakia), Slovak Sinfonietta Zilina State Chamber Orchestra, dir. Nicola Giuliani

2016 : Arsenal (Metz, France), Arsenal, Orchestre National de Lorraine, dir. Jean-François Verdier

2015 : Glasgow Royal Hall, Edinburgh Usher Hall and Dundee Caird Hall (Scotland), RSNO, Royal Scottish National Orchestra, dir. Peter Oundjiann

Competitions

2014 : First Prize Winner, Scottish International Piano Competition

2013 : Second Prize Winner, Ettore Pozzoli Piano Competition

2013 : First Prize Winner, Gian Battista Viotti Piano Competition in Vercelli
